PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will act in accordance with the decisions and arrangements made by the cpc central committee and the state council, uphold the general principle of pursuing progress while ensuring stability, and place an utmost priority on\xa0stability.\n                "}]

"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence emphasizes the general principle of pursuing progress while ensuring stability, indicating a balanced approach without any specific hawkish or dovish tone."
}

increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it will also scale up\xa0financial support for government-subsidized housing construction, public infrastructure development for both normal and emergency uses, and urban village renovation, thus facilitating the establishment of a new development model for the real estate sector.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: we will focus on supporting the expansion of domestic demand and providing stronger support for the real economy.\n                "}]

monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: outstanding balance of loans in both local and foreign currencies extended by domestic financial institutions amounted to rmb13.3 trillion yuan, increased by rmb1403.5 billion yuan or accelerated by rmb496.8 billion yuan over the same period of last year, a record high growth of the last four years.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence indicates a significant increase in the outstanding balance of loans, which suggests an expansionary monetary policy, characteristic of a dovish stance."
}

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the macro leverage ratio has remained basically stable.\n                "}]

of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: firmly implementing the “two unswervinglys”, the pboc will provide better financial services for the development and Provide a concise explanation for your classification using the `justification` key. Limit the justification to one sentence.\n            \n            3. Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was the first meeting of theadvisory body after the state council appointed new members into the committee.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the supply-side structural reform of\xa0the financial sector will be deepened to guide large banks to focus more Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: fluctuations in commodity prices and other factors have a larger impact on the world economy and the international financial markets.\n                "}]

of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the meeting analyzed the economic and financial developments both\xa0at home and abroad.\n                "}]

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will\xa0enhance judgment and analysis of the economic situations, strengthen coordination of international macroeconomic policies, concentrate on running\xa0its own affairs well,\xa0and make fine cross-cycle policy designs, so as to bolster\xa0high-quality economic development.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: adhering to the two unwavering commitments, the pboc will make coordinated efforts to implement macro policies, expand demand, conduct reform and innovation, as well as prevent and defuse risks.\n                "}]

Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was pointed out at the meeting that\xa0the national\xa0economy is performing steadily with\xa0stable and\xa0sound momentum for growth, but the overall situations at home and abroad remain complicated and challenging.\n                "}]

the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the participants analyzed the current economic and financial situation in china and beyond, and were of the view that performance of the chinese economy is still within a reasonable range.\n                "}]

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it will improve the green finance system for peaking carbon emissions and achieving carbon neutrality.\n changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will use a combination of monetary policy instruments to properly manage the strength and pace of structural deleveraging and strike a balance among interest rates, exchange rates and the country’s balance of payments, facilitate the stable and sound development of economy, stabilize market expectations, prevent and defuse financial risks, and hold the bottom line of preventing systemic financial risks.\n                "}]

monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: with the loan prime rate (lpr) reform continuously delivering benefits, the monetary policy transmission has become\xa0more efficient and the lending\xa0rates\xa0have stabilized and dropped.\n                "}]
2025-05-04 01:13:25,078 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence indicates that the loan prime rate reform has led to more efficient monetary policy transmission, stabilized and dropped lending rates, which suggests a relaxation of monetary policy."
}

policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will implement monetary policy in a flexible and targeted manner, and strengthen the\xa0coordination with fiscal, industrial, and regulatory policies.\n                "}]

"label": "Neutral",
"justification": "The sentence emphasizes the PBoC's intention to implement monetary policy in a flexible and targeted manner, without indicating a specific direction or bias, hence it is neutral."

of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pboc will make good use of policy-backed and development-oriented\xa0financial instruments, with the priorities\xa0on supporting infrastructure construction\xa0and promoting government investment to\xa0drive\xa0private investment.\n                "}]

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the monetary policy committee of the pbc convened its fourth quarterly meeting of 2012 in beijing days ago.\n namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: however, economic stabilization and recovery is not firmly established.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence implies that the economy is still recovering, which may lead to a more accommodative monetary policy to support growth."
}

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: wu xiaoling, mr. su ning, mr. xie fuzhan, ms. hu xiaolian, mr. liu mingkang,mr.\n                "}]

  \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: at end-september of 2002, broad money (m2) reached rmb17.7 trillion yuan, up 16.5%.\n                "}]

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: with the loan prime rate (lpr) reform yielding continuous dividends, monetary policy transmission has become\xa0more efficient and loan rates have steadily dropped.\n                "}]

policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was noted at the meeting that since the beginning of 2023, the pboc has sought progress while giving top priority to the stability of macro policies, implemented a sound monetary policy in a targeted and effective manner, strengthened the counter-cyclical adjustments, and used a mix of policy tools, such as interest rates and the required reserve ratio (rrr), thereby providing effective support for the real economy, effectively forestalling financial risks, and creating a sound monetary and financial environment for economic recovery.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy
